terms.definition: Standard Operating Procedure - a detailed, step-by-step instruction document that outlines how to perform routine tasks consistently and efficiently
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, ensuring teams always work with the most current version
Application Programming Interface - a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and share data with each other
A unified system where all documents, tools, and resources are stored and managed in one accessible location rather than scattered across multiple systems
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit, comment on, and update documents with changes visible instantly to all participants
A chronological record of all actions, changes, and access events within a system that provides accountability and compliance tracking
A security method that restricts system access and document permissions based on a user's specific role or responsibilities within an organization
A structured set of guidelines, standards, and regulations that organizations must follow to meet industry or legal requirements
Bring Your Own Device - a policy that allows employees to use their personal devices for work purposes while maintaining security protocols
The use of software to automatically execute business processes and tasks based on predefined rules and triggers
A centralized storage system where documents are organized, indexed, and made searchable for easy retrieval and management
The ability to embed various content types like images, videos, flowcharts, and interactive elements within documentation
The process of engaging relevant team members, departments, and decision-makers in the creation and review of documentation
